bibl.title: Letter from Simon Flexner to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 1, 1901

div1.p: Flexner reassures Emilie Lawrence Reed of her husband's safety and offers his assistance to her.

div1.head: Letter from Simon Flexner to Emilie Lawrence Reed, October 1, 1901
div1.p:
I am hoping
that this brief note
may reach you altho'
I do not chance to
have your address. Dr.
Reed sent me a note
from New York prior
to sailing for Cuba. I
can imagine your an-
xiety at his absence
in Cuba at this time,
but I have the best-
hopes that he will
keep well in view
of his long residence
in the South. I wish
that you might feel
at liberty to call upon
me at any time that
I can be of the least
service to you. With
my sincere regards
to you & Miss Blossom,
div1.closer:
Very truly, Simon Flexner. University of Pennsylvania,
Philadelphia, Oct. 1.
